Enter a valid IP address or leave empty.\nExample: 8.8.8.8

Enter a valid IP address or leave empty.\nExample: 192.168.1.1

Enter a comma-separated list of excluded domains or leave blank.\nExample: example.com,mycomp.test.com,localhost
Already connected to %1$s. Connect to a different network?

To use the apps or data this drive contains, replug it in. Alternatively, you can choose to forget this storage if the drive isn't available.

If you choose Forget, all the data the drive contains will be lost forever.

You can reinstall the apps later, but the data stored on this drive will be lost.

This requires the USB drive to be formatted to make it secure. After securely formatting, this drive will only work with this device. Formatting erases all data currently stored on the drive. To avoid losing the data, consider backing it up.
After formatting, you can use this USB drive in other devices. All data will be erased. Consider backing up first by moving apps to other device storage.
This may take a moment. Please don\'t remove the drive.
Choose storage to migrate data to
Move your photos, files and app data to %1$s. This may take a few minutes. Some apps won\'t work correctly during the move.
This may take a moment. Please don\'t remove the drive.\nSome apps won\'t work correctly during the move.
This drive appears to be slow.
You can continue, but apps moved to this location may stutter and data transfers may take a long time. Consider using a faster drive for better performance.
Apps on this device storage will stop working when it\'s ejected. This USB drive is formatted to work on this device only. It won\'t work on any others.
"Don't remove the drive during the move.\nThe %1$s app on this device won't be available until the move is complete.
All your data stored in this drive will be lost forever with \'Forget\'. Would you like to proceed?
Some apps will be unavailable or not function correctly until the drive is reconnected.
System updates can\u2019t be installed on external media.
Device Administrator can\u2019t be installed on external media.
Let apps that have asked your permission use your location information
No apps have requested location recently

Google uses this feature in products like Google Now and Google Maps. Turning on Location Reporting lets any Google product that uses this feature store and use your device\'s most recent location data in connection with your Google Account.

When Location History is turned on for this account, Google can store your device's location data for use by your apps.

For example, Google Maps can give you directions, and Google Now can inform you about commute traffic.

You can turn off Location History at any time, but doing so doesn't delete it. To view and manage your Location History, visit maps.google.com/locationhistory.
This will delete all Location History has stored from this device for this Google Account. You can\'t undo this deletion. Some apps, including Google Now, will stop working.
When the shortcut is on, you can press both the back and down buttons for 3 seconds to start an accessibility feature.

Optimize display for maximum resolution or maximum framerate. This only affects Ultra HD displays. Changing this setting will restart your device.

From best to worst: blue, green, light red, red

Do you want to reboot into safe mode?
This will disable all third party applications you have installed. They will be restored when you reboot again.
Usage access allows an app to track what other apps you\u2019re using and how often, as well as your carrier, language settings, and other details.
No installed apps have requested notification access.

These apps will be able to read all notifications, including personal information such as contact names and the text of messages you receive. They will also be able to dismiss notifications or trigger action buttons they contain.
Allow an app to display on top of other apps you\u2019re using. It may interfere with your use of those apps or change the way they seem to appear or behave.
This permission allows an app to modify system settings.
Allow apps to create a picture-in-picture window while the app is open or after you leave it (for example, to continue watching a video). This window displays on top of other apps you\'re using.
